FuncDef: This command limits the number of Multicast Source Discovery Protocol (MSDP) messages that are read from the TCP session. It is possible that an MSDP/ RP router may receive a large number of MSDP protocol message packets in a particular source active message.

ParaDef.Info: Defines the number of MSDP messages (including source active messages) that are read from the TCP session per the number of seconds. Values-10 to 10000. ParamDefault: Default- 0

This defines the time that, together with the number parameter, defines the number of MSDP messages (including source active messages) that are read from the TCP session within the configured number of seconds. Values-1 to 600. ParamDefault: Default- 0

This number reflects the number of MSDP messages can be processed before the MSDP message rate limiting function described above is activated; this is particularly of use during at system startup and initialization. Values-1 to 1000000. ParamDefault: Default- 0
